The king asked NÄgasena again, When a person wishes to do good, should they do it in advance or wait until later to do it?
They should do it in advance. Doing it later does not benefit people.
If one digs a well in the ground only when thirsty, can it quench one's thirst?
It cannot quench one's thirst. One should dig the well in advance.
For this reason, what should be done should be done in advance.
If one is hungry, should one plow the fields and wait until the grain ripens to eat it?
One should store it in advance.
People should do good in advance. It is of no benefit to one's body to do good only when in urgent need.
It is like a king who has an enemy and must go out to battle at the right time.
No, he should have provisions prepared in advance.
The Buddha said in the sutras:
People should first think of doing good, and it is of no benefit to do good later.
Do not abandon the great path and follow the wrong path, do not imitate foolish people who abandon good and do evil, and it is of no benefit to cry later.
People who abandon the correct and follow the incorrect will only regret it when they are about to die.
You Buddhist monks say that the fire in the world is not as hot as the fire in hell.
They also say that if you take a small stone and put it in the fire in the world, it will not melt by evening, but if you take a large stone and put it in the fire in hell, it will melt.
Therefore, I do not believe it.
They also say that if a person does evil and dies in hell, for many thousands of years that person will not be exhausted and die.
Therefore, I do not believe this statement.
Have you ever heard or seen that large pythons, dragons, fish, and turtles in the water eat sand and stones?
Do the sand and stones get digested?
Do the embryos in their bellies also get digested?
It is because of their unique fate that they do not get digested.
Why don't the millions of people in hell who do not digest for thousands of years die?
It is because their evil karma has not yet been exhausted that they do not die without digesting.
Lions, tigers, and wolves all eat meat and bones. When they enter the stomach, are they digested or not?
Are the bones in the womb of a pregnant woman also digested?
Because they have their own unique vitality, they are not digested and die.
Do cows, horses, deer, and elk all eat grass?
Is the grass digested in the stomach?
Is the fetus in the womb digested?
It is because of the natural course of fate that it is not digested.
It is the same in the hells. Because the evil karma has not yet been exhausted, they do not die from indigestion.
In the world, women eat all kinds of delicious food to their heart's content. Is it digested in their stomachs?
Is it digested when they are carrying a child in their womb?
It is because of the natural course of fate that it is not digested.

It is the same in the hells. The reason they do not die for many thousands of years from indigestion is because they have not yet resolved the evil karma they created in the past, so they do not die from indigestion.
People are born in hell, grow up in hell, and grow old in hell, and only after their allotted time is up do they die.
You monks say that the earth is all on the water, the water is on the wind, and the wind is in the sky.
Ä€nanda first took the king's writing water, and just picked it up with his finger, and asked the king:
The wind holds the water like this.
Is the path to nirvana all in the past, with nothing left?
The path to nirvana has nothing left.
Foolish people are greedy for the body and cherish it. Because of this, they are unable to attain liberation from birth, old age, sickness, and death.
The wise who study the Way, internally and externally, do not cherish the body, and thus have no affection.

Those without affection have no greed, those without greed have no womb, those without a womb are not born, those not born do not age, those not aging do not get sick, those not sick do not die, those not dying do not grieve, those not grieving do not cry, those not crying do not suffer, and thus attain the Way of nirvana.
Can all those who study the Way attain the Way of nirvana?
Not all can attain the Way of nirvana.

Those who are upright and good at the Way study and know the right things, and should practice what should be practiced and abandon what should not be practiced. They should think of what should be thought of and abandon what should not be thought of. In this way, they can attain the Way of nirvana.
Those who have not attained the path to nirvana, do they know that the path to nirvana is blissful?
Although they have not yet attained the path to nirvana, they know that the path to nirvana is blissful.
How do people who have not attained the path to nirvana know that it is blissful?
A person who has never had their hands and feet cut off, do they know that having one's hands and feet cut off is extremely painful?
Although I have never had my hands and feet cut off, I still know that it is painful.
Why do you know that it is painful?
I see people who have had their hands and feet cut off moaning in pain, and for this reason I know that it is painful.
Previously there were people who attained the path to nirvana, and they passed it on to each other, saying that the path to nirvana is blissful. For this reason, I believe it.
Have you ever seen the Buddha?
Have your teachers ever seen the Buddha?
My teachers have also not seen the Buddha.
If you and your teachers have not seen the Buddha, then there is definitely no Buddha.
Have you ever seen where five hundred streams come together?
Have your father and grandfather seen the water?
If your father and grandfather have not seen this water, does it mean that there is definitely no place where five hundred streams come together in the world?ğŸ”½The king said:
Although I have not seen it, and my father and grandfather have not seen this water either, it really exists.
Although I and all the teachers have not seen the Buddha, he really exists.
Is there no one superior to the Buddha?
There is no one superior to the Buddha.
Why is there no one who can surpass the Buddha?
If a person has never entered the ocean, can he know whether the seawater is great or not?
There are five rivers, each with five hundred smaller rivers flowing into the great rivers.
The first river is called the Ganges, the second is called the Sindhu, the third is called the Vaksu, the fourth is called the ÅšÄ«tÄ, and the fifth is called the YamunÄ.
The waters of the five rivers flow day and night into the ocean, yet the seawater does not increase or decrease.
Can the king hear and know this?
Because those who have attained the Way speak of the Dharma together, there is no one who can surpass the Buddha. This is why I have faith in it.
What is the use of knowing that there is no one who can surpass the Buddha?
Who is the creator of writing?
The creator of writing is named Qi.
Has the king ever seen Qi?
Qi has been dead for a long time, I have never seen him.
Since the king has never seen Qi, why do you know that Qi is the creator of writing?
The ancient written characters are passed down from generation to generation. For this reason, I know that he is called Qi.
For this reason, we see the Buddha's sutras and precepts as if we were seeing the Buddha himself.

The sutras spoken by the Buddha are profound and delightful, and after understanding the Buddha's sutras and precepts, we follow them. For this reason, I know that there is no one who can surpass the Buddha.
Have you seen the Buddha's sutras and can you practice them for a long time?
The teachings, precepts, and sutras bestowed by the Buddha are excellent, and we should uphold and practice them until old age.
After a person dies, does their body not follow to the next life?
After a person dies, they take on a new body, so the old body does not follow.
It is like a candle wick burning itself out, the old wick remains while a new wick continues to burn.
A person's body is like this, the old body does not continue, but a new body is taken on.
When you were a child, did you learn writing and scriptures from a teacher?
Did the teacher from whom you received the scriptures and writing know the original scriptures and writing?
Did you take back all the original scriptures and writing?
The teacher still knew the original scriptures and writing himself.
The human body is like this, discarding the old body and receiving a new body.
Are you really wise or not?
For example, if a person steals fruits from others, is the thief guilty or not?
When planting a tree, there are no fruits at the top. Why would a thief have a crime?
If it is not planted, how can there be fruits?
Therefore, a thief has no crime.
People are also like this. Using the body of this world to do good and evil, they are reborn in the next world and receive a new body.
People use this body to do good and evil and go to (certain realms).
All the good and evil that people do follows them, like a shadow follows the body.
When a person dies, they only lose their body, not their actions.
It is like writing at night by fire. When the fire goes out, the letters remain. The fire comes again and completes them.
The actions done in this world are completed in the next world, and one receives them like this.
Can you discern and point out where good and evil exist?
Good and evil cannot be known to exist.
Before trees have fruit, can the king discern and point out that a certain branch has a certain fruit, and that a certain branch has no fruit?
Can he know this in advance?
People who have not attained the Way cannot know in advance where good and evil exist.
Can those who are to be reborn in the next world know it themselves?
Those who are to be reborn know it themselves.
What use is it to know?

It is like a farmer who plows and plants, and the rain falls in a timely manner. Can that person know in advance whether they will obtain grain or not?
They know that the field will yield much grain.
People are like this. People will be reborn in the next world, and they can know in advance.
Is there really nirvÄá¹‡a or not?
Can you point out to me where the Buddha is?
I cannot point out where the Buddha is.
The Buddha has already entered nirvÄá¹‡a and cannot be pointed out to be seen.
It is like when a person lights a large fire and then extinguishes it. Can one still point out where the light is?
One cannot know where it is.
The Buddha has already entered nirvÄá¹‡a and his whereabouts cannot be known again.
If Å›ramaá¹‡as do not love themselves, why do they seek to rest and sleep, desire comfort and warmth, seek delicious food and drink, and protect themselves?
Has the king ever entered into battle?
While in battle, have you ever been wounded by a sword, arrow, or spear?
I have indeed been wounded by a sword.
What does it matter if the knife is sharp or the arrowhead is sharp?
I wrap the wound with ointment and cotton.
Is it because you love the wound that you wrap it with ointment and cotton?
I do not love the wound.
If you do not love the wound at all, why do you hold it and protect it with ointment, cotton, and fluff?
I want the wound to heal quickly.

They do not love their bodies. Although they eat and drink, they do not enjoy it. They do not use it to make themselves beautiful or have good skin color. They just want to sustain their bodies and practice the Buddha's sutras and precepts.
The Buddha's sutras say that people have nine orifices, which are like nine arrow wounds. All the orifices are foul-smelling and impure.
Does the Buddha have a body with thirty-two marks and eighty minor characteristics, all golden in color with radiance and shadow?
The Buddha indeed has a body with thirty-two marks and eighty minor characteristics, all golden in color with radiance and shadow.
Do the Buddha's parents have the thirty-two marks and eighty minor characteristics, all golden in color with radiance and shadow?
The Buddha's parents do not have these marks.
If these marks are not possessed by the parents, then the Buddha also does not have these marks.
When a person gives birth to a child, it resembles its kind. If the parents do not have these marks, then the Buddha definitely does not have these marks.
Although the Buddha's parents do not have the thirty-two marks and eighty minor characteristics, with a golden radiance, the Buddha indeed has these marks.
Have you ever seen a lotus flower?
This lotus is born from the earth and grows in muddy water.
Its color is very beautiful, but does it resemble the color of the mud and water?
It does not resemble the color of the earth or muddy water.
Although the Buddha's parents did not have these characteristics, the Buddha indeed had them.
The Buddha was born in the world and grew up in the world, but he did not resemble worldly affairs.
Is it true that the Buddha, like the gods of the seventh heaven, did not have sexual relations with women?
He indeed avoided women, pure and clean, without any defilement.
If the Buddha were to practice like the king of the seventh heaven, the Buddha would be a disciple of the Brahma of the seventh heaven.
Does the king of the seventh heaven have thoughts or not?
The Brahma of the seventh heaven has thoughts.
Therefore, the Brahma of the seventh heaven and the gods above are all disciples of the Buddha.
What kind of sound does an elephant make?
The sound of an elephant is like the sound of a goose.
In that case, is the elephant a disciple of the goose?
Are they each of a different kind?
The Buddha is also like this, not a disciple of the Brahma of the seventh heaven.
Does the Buddha completely study and know the sutras and precepts?
The Buddha has studied and understood all the scriptures and precepts and practices them.
From whom did the Buddha receive the scriptures and precepts?
When the Buddha attained enlightenment, he immediately understood all the scriptures and paths by himself.
The Buddha is not like the disciples who study and understand. The Buddha teaches the disciples to practice until old age.
When people's parents die, they cry and tears flow. When people hear the Buddha's scriptures, they also cry and tears flow. Are they the same or different?
When people cry for their parents, it is all out of gratitude, love, and thoughts of sorrow and pain.
These sorrows are foolish sorrows. Those who hear the Buddha's scriptures and have tears flow, all have a compassionate heart, thinking of the hardships in the world, and therefore tears flow.
The merit they obtain is very great.
What are the differences between those who have attained liberation?
People who have not attained liberation have greedy minds, while those who have attained liberation have no greedy minds, but only wish to obtain food to sustain their lives.
I see that people in the world all want to indulge their bodies and obtain delicious food without being satisfied.
People who have not attained liberation eat and drink to enjoy themselves and seek delicious flavors.
Those who have attained liberation, although they eat and drink, do not take it as pleasure or sweetness, but only wish to sustain their lives.
Can people remember things from a long time ago when they do something?
When people are sad, they all remember things from a long time ago.
What do you remember, Your Majesty?
Have you ever learned something and then remembered it later?
I have learned something, but then suddenly forgotten it.
At that time, did you not have intention and thus forget it?
It is possible, because you have elephants, Your Majesty.
Do people always remember what they do?
If they start to do something, do they use mindfulness to know what they are doing?
Past events are all known through memory, and present events are also known through memory.
In this way, people only remember past events and cannot remember new events.
Even if a beginner has something to do, the same is true for what should not be thought about.
Is it a waste for a person to newly learn writing and skills?
When a person newly learns writing and painting, they have thoughts, and in order to make their students learn and understand, they have thoughts.
How many things does a person use to give rise to thoughts?
A person generally has sixteen things that give rise to thoughts.

First, remembering what was done long ago; second, remembering what was learned recently; third, remembering if there is a great matter; fourth, remembering to think good; fifth, remembering past suffering; sixth, remembering to contemplate oneself; seventh, remembering past mixed deeds; eighth, remembering to teach others; ninth, remembering elephants; tenth, remembering what was once forgotten; eleventh, remembering due to recognition; twelfth, remembering to calculate; thirteenth, remembering debts; fourteenth, remembering to be single-minded; fifteenth, remembering to read books; sixteenth, remembering to return a favor when seeing it again.
These are the sixteen things that give rise to memory.
What is meant by long-term memory?
The Buddha's disciple Ananda and his female disciple Upasika Kousinariki can recall the events of a thousand koá¹­is of past lives, as well as other practitioners who can recall past lives.
Like Ananda and his female disciples, there are many who can do this, and they give rise to thoughts accordingly.
What are the thoughts that arise from newly learned knowledge?
It is like a person who has learned and understood calculations but later forgets them.
When they see others calculating, they give rise to thoughts again.
What are the thoughts that arise from great matters?
It is like when a prince is enthroned as king, he thinks of his own greatness and nobility, and this is a thought that arises from a great matter.
What are the thoughts that arise from thinking of goodness?
It is like when a person is invited by others, and they receive an extremely good-natured invitation and hospitality.
In the past, I was invited by someone, and they treated me with good intentions, this is thinking of good and giving rise to thoughts.
What is it to give rise to thoughts of suffering again?
It is like a person who has been beaten and imprisoned by others, this is giving rise to thoughts of suffering again.
What is it to give rise to thoughts of self-reflection?
It is like a person who has seen their family, relatives, and animals, this is giving rise to thoughts of self-reflection.
What is it to give rise to thoughts of past mixed actions?
It is like a person who thinks of the names, colors, smells, sourness, bitterness, and other things of myriad objects, this is giving rise to thoughts of the past mixed [actions].
What is meant by teaching people to remember?
People themselves are forgetful, some remember and some forget, this is teaching people to remember.
What is meant by elephants giving rise to thoughts?
People, cows, and horses each have their own kind of elephants, this is elephants giving rise to thoughts.
What is meant by things that have been forgotten giving rise to thoughts?
It is like a person who suddenly forgets something and repeatedly thinks about it alone, this is things that have been forgotten giving rise to thoughts.
What is meant by giving rise to thoughts based on recognition?
A person who has learned to write can arrange the characters, this is giving rise to thoughts based on recognition.
What is meant by giving rise to thoughts through calculation?
It is like when people discuss and calculate together, fully understanding and clearly discerning the strategies, this is called the arising of thoughts through discussion and calculation.
What is meant by the arising of thoughts due to debts?
It is like when a person has debts that need to be repaid, this is called the arising of thoughts due to debts.
What is meant by the arising of thoughts due to a single mind?
When a Å›ramaá¹‡a unifies his mind and reflects on the events of his past lives for thousands of millions of eons, this is called the arising of thoughts due to a unified mind.
What is meant by the arising of thoughts due to reading books?

The emperor has ancient books, and he thinks to himself, 'This book was written during the time of such-and-such emperor and such-and-such official,' this is called the arising of thoughts due to reading books.
What is meant by the arising of thoughts upon seeing something entrusted to one in the past?
If a person has something entrusted to them and sees it again, they give rise to the thought, 'This is what was entrusted to me.'
Does the Buddha know all past and future events?
The Buddha knows all of them.
If the Buddha knows all events, why didn't he teach his disciples all at once? Why did he teach them gradually?
Are there any physicians in the country?
Can those physicians know all the medicines in the world?
They can know all the medicines.
When the physician treats a person's illness, does he give the medicine all at once or gradually?
One cannot give medicine in advance before one is sick, one can only give medicine when one is sick.
Although the Buddha knows all past, present, and future events, he cannot teach the people of the world all at once, he must gradually bestow the sutras and precepts and have them practice them.
You monks say that if a person commits evil for a hundred years in the world, but at the moment of death thinks of the Buddha, after death they are all reborn in the heavens.
They also say that if one kills a life, upon death one immediately enters the hells.
I do not believe this either.
If a person holds a small stone and places it on the water, does the stone float or sink?
Suppose you were to place a hundred large stones on a boat, would the boat sink?
The hundred large stones in the boat do not sink because of the boat.
Although a person may have evil in their past, if they think of the Buddha for a moment, because of this they will not enter the hells, but will be reborn in the heavens.
The small stones that sink are like a person who does evil and does not know the Buddha's scriptures, after death they will enter the hells.
For what reason do you practice the path and become an ascetic?
I now wish to abandon the suffering of the past, present, and future, and do not wish to experience it again, so I practice the path and become an ascetic.
Suffering is in the afterlife, why study the Way in advance and become a Å›ramaá¹‡a?
Does your country have enemies who want to attack?
There are always enemies who want to attack.
When the enemy is about to come, do you prepare for battle and dig moats,
or do you prepare in advance?
You should have reserves in advance.
Why do you prepare in advance?
Because the enemy's arrival has no fixed time.
Since the enemy has not yet come, why prepare in advance?
Why prepare in advance when you are hungry and plant fields, thirsty and dig wells?
How far is it from the seventh Brahma Heaven?
If a stone the size of the king's palace were dropped from the seventh Brahma Heaven, it would take six days to fall to the ground here.
You monks say that those who have attained the stage of arhat can fly up to the seventh Brahma Heaven in the time it takes to bend and extend one's arm.
How can traveling millions and billions of miles be so fast?
What country were you born in?
I was born in the great Qin country, named Alichan.
How many miles is it from Alichan to here?
It is two thousand yojanas, or eighty thousand miles.
Have you ever thought about the affairs of your homeland from afar?
I always think about the affairs of my homeland.
Your Majesty, please think again about the affairs of your homeland and what you have done.
I have already thought about it.
Why is it that you traveled 80,000 li back and forth so quickly?
If two people die here together, one is reborn in the seventh Brahma heaven and the other is reborn in KaÅ›mÄ«ra.
KaÅ›mÄ«ra is 720 li away. Who will arrive first?
Please think of the country of Arli.
I have already thought of it.
Your Majesty, please think of KaÅ›mÄ«ra again.
I have already thought about it.
Thinking about these two countries, which one is faster?
If two people die together, one is reborn in the seventh heaven, and the other is reborn in KÄÅ›i, it is also equal.
If there is a pair of flying birds, one perches on a tall tree, and the other perches on a low tree, when the two birds fly together, whose shadow falls on the ground first?
Their shadows reach the ground at the same time.
If two people die together, one is reborn in the seventh heaven, and the other is reborn in KÄÅ›i, they will arrive at the same time.
How many things does a person use to study and understand the Way?
Using seven things to study and understand the Way.

First, thinking of good and evil things, second, diligence, third, delighting in the Way, fourth, subduing the mind to be good, fifth, thinking of the Way, sixth, single-mindedness, seventh, being impartial without aversion or attachment.
Do people study and understand the Way using these seven things?
Not all seven things are used to study and understand the Way.
Those who know hold the knowledge of good and evil, and use this one thing to distinguish and know.
If one uses one thing to know, why speak of seven things?
Suppose someone holds a knife in its sheath leaning against a wall, can the knife cut anything by itself?
Although the human mind is clear and united, it must obtain these six things to accomplish wisdom.
If a person does good, does he obtain great blessings?
If he does evil, does he obtain great misfortune?
If a person does good, he obtains great blessings. If he does evil, he obtains little misfortune.
If a person does evil but repents of it day by day, then his transgression becomes smaller day by day.
If a person does good, he rejoices in it day and night, and therefore obtains great blessings.
Formerly when the Buddha was in the world, there was a person in the country who dug up a lotus flower with no hands or feet and offered it to the Buddha.
The Buddha then told the bhiká¹£us:
'This child with no hands or feet will not enter the hells, animal realm, or path of the hungry ghosts for ninety-one kalpas from now on, and will be reborn in the heavens.
When his life in the heavens ends, he will be reborn as a human again.
Therefore, I know that a person who does a small good gets great blessings.
If a person who does evil repents, the transgression will dissipate and disappear over time.
Therefore, I know that a person who does wrong receives little retribution.
If a wise person does evil and a foolish person does evil, which of these two people receives more retribution?
A foolish person who does evil receives great retribution, while a wise person who does evil receives little retribution.
I do not understand what Ä€nanda says.
In my country's legal system, if a minister commits an offense, the punishment is heavy, while if a commoner commits an offense, the punishment is light.
Therefore, I know that a wise person who commits an offense receives great retribution, while a foolish person who commits an offense receives little retribution.
It's like a burning iron on the ground. One person knows it's a burning iron, and one person doesn't know. The two people both go forward to pick up the burning iron. Whose hand will burn more?
The one who doesn't know will burn his hand more.
A fool commits evil and cannot repent, so his calamity is great.
A wise person commits evil, knowing it is not what should be done, and repents daily, so his calamity is small.
Can a person carry this body and fly up to the seventh Brahma heaven, to the land of Uttarakuru, and to wherever they want to go?
How can one carry this body to the seventh Brahma heaven, to the land of Uttarakuru, and to wherever they want to go?
Does the king remember when he was young, jumping a distance of ten feet?
When I was young, I thought of jumping, and I jumped more than ten feet.
A person who has attained the path, if they wish to jump to the seventh heaven or to the land of Uttarakuru, it is also like this.
You Å›ramaá¹‡as say there are bones four thousand li long.
What kind of body has bones four thousand li long?
Has the king heard of a fish in the great ocean named Tilapia, whose body is twenty-eight thousand li long?
The rib bones of such a twenty-eight thousand li fish are four thousand li long. What do you think of this, king?
You Å›ramaá¹‡as say that you can cut off the activity of breathing.
How can one cut off the breath?
Have you ever heard of concentration?
Do you think concentration is in the human body?
I think concentration is in the human body.
Those who are foolish and cannot control their body and mouth cannot uphold the precepts. Such people also do not enjoy their bodies.
Those who study the Way can control their body, control their mouth, uphold the precepts, and unify their mind to attain the four dhyÄnas, and then they can stop breathing.
Is it called the ocean because the ocean is the name of the water,
or is it called the ocean for another reason?
The reason people call it the ocean is because the water and salt are mixed together equally, therefore it is called the ocean.
Why is the seawater salty like salt?
The reason the seawater is salty is because over a long time, fish, turtles, and many insects have been soaking in the water, therefore it has become salty.
Can one who has attained the Way still contemplate all the profound matters?
One who has attained the Way can contemplate all the profound matters.
The Buddha's sutras are the most profound and can understand all matters, and the immeasurable matters are all evaluated by wisdom.
Are the wisdoms of humans, gods, and nature the same or different?
Humans and gods are born with awareness, the wise understand the Way, and nature is empty space with no people.
People say they have attained humanity, what does it mean to have attained humanity?

Now the eyes see forms, the ears hear sounds, the nose smells fragrances and foul odors, the mouth knows tastes, the body knows softness and roughness, and the mind knows good and evil matters, which of these is attaining humanity?
Now, when the eyes are opened, if the pupils are removed, will the vision be wider and farther?
If the ears are torn open, will the hearing of sounds be wider and farther?
If you enlarge the nose, would the sense of smell not be greatly enhanced?
If you enlarge the mouth, would the knowledge of taste not be greatly increased?
If you peel away the skin and flesh, would it not make one fully aware of smoothness and roughness?
If you remove the mind, would the thoughts not be greatly increased?
What the Buddha does is extremely difficult, and what the Buddha knows is extremely wonderful.
What is extremely difficult to do and what is extremely wonderful?
The Buddha can know what is in a person's belly that the eyes cannot see, and can understand it all.
He can understand eye matters, ear matters, nose matters, mouth matters, body matters, business matters, thought matters, and spirit matters.
If a person were to take seawater and drink it, could they distinguish which water in their mouth came from a certain spring, a certain stream, or a certain river?
The various waters all combine into one, and it is difficult to know each one separately.
What the Buddha does is very difficult, and he can distinguish them all.
